intro: Hermannia fragrans, commonly known as the sweet-scented hermannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and emit a sweet, honey-like fragrance. Hermannia fragrans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
